name: nytimes
text: A new law in Hong Kong takes aim at dissent, creating a challenge to free expression. We documented the changing nature of speech. https://t.co/JDNQFSrij8

name: nytimes
text: In interviews with more than a dozen Black residents in the Kenosha area, many said they were outraged over the shooting of Jacob Blake. But some said they had grown dispirited and cynical about the political system. https://t.co/hk9ABXEgO1

name: nytimes
text: RT @MichaelPaulson: A tough choice for a tough time: Jessika D. Williams resigned from @ActorsEquity to perform the title role in "Othello" at @shakespearectr in Virginia. Why? She needed to work. She felt safe. But, she says, "It was a really, really tough decision for me." https://t.co/J1AUg7VaYO

name: nytimes
text: Maureen Dowd talks to Reed Hastings, who helped grow Netflix into the Godzilla of the entertainment world. Her first question: Does it feel good to be the man who killed Hollywood? https://t.co/WtwjJ8O41l

name: nytimes
text:
RT @anniekarni: RVAT has been trying to get Kelly on the record on Trump.

Kristol said the pitch is: “don’t say a word about private conversations with the president, just give us your judgment.”

Some friends want him to speak out. So far, nothing.  https://t.co/qb0JiYJZ8h

name: nytimes
text: Interviews with Breonna Taylor’s family, her boyfriend, witnesses and public officials — along with a review of jailhouse recordings, 911 calls and 1,500+ pages of police records — reveal a clearer picture of her life and her death in a botched drug raid. https://t.co/RspjlPCwms

name: nytimes
text: An examination by The New York Times of the official response to Daniel Prude’s death shows that police and city officials in Rochester, New York, withheld information about their handling of the case. https://t.co/lbRX2a2phA
